You open up a chasm beneath your foes, attempting to trap them within. The chasm affects the ground in a @Template[type:line|distance:30]. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects. When you refresh, the chasm disappears, and any creature immobilized or trapped is freed.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected

Success The creature slams against the edges of the fissure, taking @Damage[(@actor.level*2)[bludgeoning]] damage, but it manages to avoid falling into the fissure.

Failure The creature falls partway into the chasm, smashing violently against the sides. It takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]] damage, and it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it spends a single action, which has the move trait, to extricate itself.

Critical Failure The creature falls fully into the abyss, roughly impacting every abutting ledge on the way down. It takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d10[bludgeoning]] damage and is trapped at the bottom of a 40-foot chasm (@Check[type:athletics|dc:15] to Climb).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 2 on a success, or 1d8 on a failure, or 1d10 on a critical failure.

Flame Whip.name: Flame Whip
Flame Whip.description:
You lash out at your foe with a whip formed of smoke and flame. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll} against a foe up to 5 feet farther away from you than your normal reach (typically 10 feet if you have a 5 foot reach), dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[fire]] damage, as well as @Damage[(3+(floor(@actor.level/2)))[persistent,fire]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double fire damage and persistent fire damage to the target.

Success You deal normal fire damage and persistent fire damage to the target.

Failure The whip misses, dealing no fire damage, but a few embers ignite the target, dealing @Damage[(floor((3+(floor(@actor.level/2)))/2))[persistent,fire]] damage.

Critical Failure The whip misses completely, and the target is unharmed.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d8.

Level (+2) The persistent fire damage increases by 1.

Flamethrower.name: Flamethrower
Flamethrower.description:
You release a torrent of flame, burning those in the flamethrower's path. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, as well as @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))[persistent,fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:60], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Level (+2) The persistent damage is increased by 1.

Flash Freeze.name: Flash Freeze
Flash Freeze.description:
You flash freeze the ground, freezing creatures in the area and potentially causing them to trip. Creatures on the ground within an emanation with your choice of radius up to 15 feet must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 7th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, the largest radius you can choose increases by 5 feet, to a maximum of 35 feet at 19th level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 4} and you can choose to knock the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 5} and you can choose to knock the creature prone.

Flensing Leaps.name: Flensing Leaps
Flensing Leaps.description:
You create rapidly spinning torrents of air beneath your feet and leap onto your enemies, slicing them as you bounce from foe to foe. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, up to a maximum of 30 feet (regardless of your normal Leap distance). If you choose to Leap into a foe's space, attempt a melee power attack, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[slashing]] depending on the results of your power attack roll, and you Leap again unless the power attack roll critically failed. As long as you continue to Leap into the space of a foe whose space you've not yet entered with Flensing Leaps, you can bounce off the head of each foe into the next, continuing to make @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack rolls} against each foe and Leaping again; these attack rolls all apply to your multiple attack penalty, but not until after you attempt all of them. Once you Leap without entering a new foe's space, or critically fail a power attack roll, Flensing Leaps ends.

Critical Success You deal double slashing damage and you get a great rebound, allowing you to Leap an additional 10 feet on your next Leap with Flensing Leaps.

Success You deal normal slashing damage and can Leap normally.

Failure You're able to Leap off the foe, but the slashing winds don't deal much damage.The target only takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[slashing]] damage.

Critical Failure You miss your target and your bouncing ends. You land in your choice of space adjacent to the target and within range of your Leap, and you don't Leap again.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d8, or 1 on a failure.

Flickering Fantasy.name: Flickering Fantasy
Flickering Fantasy.description:
You form a scene out of light within an area up to 30 feet by 30 feet within 180 feet, painting your own truth including up to 10 discrete creatures or objects. When you use Flickering Fantasy, all foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save, as the projections of light assault them in a way that corresponds to the illusion. The scene continues to play out as you choose until you Refresh, though your foes don't take any more damage.

Creatures interacting with the scene, touching the scene, using a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action on the scene, and the like can attempt to disbelieve the illusion. Since the scene is a projection of light it doesn't include sounds or smells, though it is capable of generating warmth and touch.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Force Curtain.name: Force Curtain
Force Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of force across the battlefield, damaging and repositioning foes that move through. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of force up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet} long in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[force]] damage and you can reposition them 5 feet. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes force damage and the reposition effect from Force Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times (perhaps because you repositioned it back across the curtain).

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Force Field.name: Force Field
Force Field.description: You create an enormous force field around you to recharge your force powers and push away projectiles as they come your way. For 1 round, physical ranged attacks against you or an ally within a 30- foot emanation take a circumstance penalty depending on the size of the ranged weapon. Attacks that use arrows, bolts, bullets, or similar ammunition take a –4 circumstance penalty, attacks with bigger ranged weapons, such as javelins, take a –2 circumstance penalty. Massive ranged weapons and spell effects that don't rely on physical objects pass through the winds with no penalty. You Refresh your powers.

Force Gambit.name: Force Gambit
Force Gambit.description: Using strands of force to rearrange the force energy and refresh your powers, you shift your allies' positions, moving them into flanking positions, backing them off to safety, or advancing past a foe's reach. All willing allies within 60 feet Step in the direction you choose (this can be a different direction for each ally). You Refresh your powers.

Force Intrusion.name: Force Intrusion
Force Intrusion.description:
You intrude upon your foe with magical forces that run contrary to its motion and body. Choose a creature within 120 feet. The target takes @Damage[(3d6+@actor.level)[persistent,force]] damage, depending on its @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Whenever it fails the flat check to remove the persistent force damage from Force Intrusion at the end of each of its turns, you can reposition the target up to 10 feet.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes the persistent force damage, but it automatically succeeds on its flat check to remove the persistent damage after the first time it takes the persistent force damage.

Failure The target takes the persistent force damage.

Critical Failure The target takes the persistent force damage, and the flat check to remove the persistent force damage is 20, or 15 for especially effective assistance.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Force Jab.name: Force Jab
Force Jab.description:
You jab a foe with force from an unexpected direction, moving them where you see fit. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll} against a foe within your reach, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[force]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double force damage and you can reposition the foe up to 10 feet and throw off its stance, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Success You deal normal force damage and you choose to either reposition the foe 5 feet or to throw off the foe's stance, making it off-guard until the end of your next turn.

Failure You don't harm the foe, but the force still interferes with its positioning. The foe chooses whether to either let you reposition it 5 feet or to throw off its stance, making it off-guard until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure Your jab misses completely, and the foe is unaffected.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Force Maneuver.name: Force Maneuver
Force Maneuver.description:
You use your strands of force to interfere with your foe. You can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} a creature within 60 feet using a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack roll} instead of an Athletics check. At 7th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, the maximum range increases by 30 feet, to a maximum of 180 feet at 19th level. Additionally, starting at 7th level, a creature takes @Damage[(@actor.level)[force]] damage on a successful power attack roll and @Damage[(2*@actor.level)[force]] damage on a critical success.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Force Missile Fusillade.name: Force Missile Fusillade
Force Missile Fusillade.description:
You fire off an outrageous number of force missiles at foes, tying threads of force to allow them to home in on targets until they hit. Your fusillade contains a number of missiles equal to your level + 1. You can divide them among as many targets within 120 feet as you choose, up a maximum of the number of missiles in your fusillade.

Make @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack rolls} against each creature you targeted in this way (a single attack roll per creature regardless of how many missiles you fire at the creature), dealing a combined total of @Damage[1d6[force]] damage per missile directed at that creature based on your power attack roll.

If you fail a flat check to target a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} creature, instead of losing the missiles entirely, you apply the critical failure effect below.

Critical Success Your missiles critically hit the target, dealing double damage.

Success Your missiles hit the target, dealing normal damage.

Failure Some of the missiles hit, and the others circle around to try again. Half of the missiles you directed at the target hit (rounded down), dealing normal damage only for the missiles that hit. At the beginning of each of your turns until you refresh, attempt another attack roll against the creature with the remaining missiles.

Critical Failure As failure, except all the missiles miss and circle around to try again.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.oQyoIIAqt0N0PbQq]{Effect: Force Missile Fusillade (Miss)}

Force Propel.name: Force Propel
Force Propel.description:
You send threads of force to damage and reposition a foe at range. Make a @Check[eldamon-power-attack|against:ac]{ranged power attack roll} against a foe within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[force]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double force damage to the foe, and you can reposition the foe up to 10 feet.

Success You deal normal force damage to the foe, and you can reposition the foe up to 5 feet.

Failure The threads of force deal minor damage but aren't enough to move the foe unless they choose to move with the attack to negate the damage. Your foe chooses whether to take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[force]] damage or to let you reposition it up to 5 feet.

Critical Failure The force threads miss completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or 1 on a failure.

Force Rebuff.name: Force Rebuff
Force Rebuff.description:
Trigger A creature hits you with a melee attack.

Every action has an equal but opposite reaction, and you increase that reaction and alter its direction when a foe strikes you, sending them out of position to disrupt their defenses, reposition them, or both. They must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature chooses whether to let you reposition it 5 feet or to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of its next turn.

Failure You reposition the creature 5 feet and it becomes off-guard until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure You reposition the creature 10 feet and it becomes off-guard for 2 rounds.

Force Shield.name: Force Shield
Force Shield.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

You create a variety of forces in the shape of a shield to throw the attack off-balance and possibly reposition it to attack something else. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC until the end of the triggering creature's turn.

If the triggering creature's attack roll critically fails against you while the force shield is active, you can choose another target other than the attacker that's adjacent to you and within reach (for a melee attack) or range (for a ranged attack); the attacker rerolls their attack roll against the new target and applies the effects of the new roll.

Forced Link.name: Forced Link
Forced Link.description:
You forcibly link your life force with that of a nearby enemy, causing them to take some of the harm meant for you. Choose a living foe within 30 feet. Whenever you take damage (after applying weaknesses, resistances, and the like), the foe loses a number of Hit Points equal to half your level, or the amount of damage you would take, whichever is less. Reduce the damage you would take by the same amount. The foe can attempt to resist the link with a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save, with the following effects. If the foe dies or is destroyed, the link ends.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success You apply the forced link, and it lasts for 1 round.

Failure You apply the forced link, and it lasts until you refresh.

Critical Failure You apply the forced link for twice the normal amount of Hit Points, and it lasts until you refresh.

Forceful Embrace.name: Forceful Embrace
Forceful Embrace.description:
You surround yourself with threads of force, potentially repositioning creatures who come in contact with you. Until you refresh, you can reposition adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, depending on the results of their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure You can reposition the creature up to 5 feet. The creature takes @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))[force]]{force damage} equal to half your level.

Critical Failure You can reposition the creature up to 10 feet. The creature takes @Damage[(@actor.level)[force]]{force damage} equal to your level.

Forceful Exile.name: Forceful Exile
Forceful Exile.description:
Trigger A foe within 60 feet takes a move action

As your foe begins to move, you quickly reposition them with force first. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success Your foe resists some of the forces you send to bedevil them, but you still send them off-course. Just before they move, you reposition them 10 feet (or the farthest they would be able to move with their land Speed, climb Speed, fly Speed, or swim Speed in the unlikely event this is less).

Failure You send the foe where you want them right before they move, potentially meddling with their plans. Just before they move, you force the foe to Stride (or to climb, fly, or Swim if it has those Speeds). Since you're moving them, this doesn't cost them any actions. Although the movement is based on their own Speed, this is still forced movement, and so as normal it doesn't trigger reactions based on movement or allow you to reposition them through hazardous terrain, off ledges, or the like.

Critical Failure The foe loses its way completely as you spirit it away with threads of force. As failure, but the forces also disrupts the foe's triggering move action.

Forked Lightning.name: Forked Lightning
Forked Lightning.description:
You electrocute a foe, and the lightning forks off to strike nearby charged creatures. Choose a foe within 40 feet. The lightning branches to hit all shocked creatures other than you within @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} of the initial target.

The target and the additional shocked creatures take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[electricity]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. Choose one:

  • You either become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}
  • You discharge to increase the damage to @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[electricity]] damage. If you discharge, you can choose an initial target up to 60 feet away, and the additional targets need to be within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} of the initial target.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4, or 1d8 on discharge.

Frigid Embrace.name: Frigid Embrace
Frigid Embrace.description:
You blanket yourself in an air of ineffable cold, chilling those who come in contact with you. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[(@actor.level)[cold]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Gather Pollen.description:
You gather jagged pollen around a foe, either sowing flowers with concealing pollen around your foe or else harvesting nearby plans to sicken the foe with their allergens. Choose a foe within 60 feet. The target foe takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around your foe (including their space), creating large flowers that release a cloud of pollen as long as they remain in the area. Creatures in the same space as a flower you sowed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by the pollen, and creatures outside the area become concealed to creatures within. This doesn't make creatures concealed to you, whether you are in the area or out of it. 
  • Harvest: You harvest in the foe's space or an adjacent square, transforming the plant matter into additional allergenic pollen and sickening the foe. On a successful Fortitude save (though not a critical success), the target takes a –1 status penalty to attack rolls, Perception checks, and skill checks for 1 round, on a failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}, and on a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.zSmLnnJTRlyS3Gvf]{Effect: Gather Pollen}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
Gather Pollen.name: Gather Pollen

Gelid Touch.name: Gelid Touch
Gelid Touch.description:
You lunge at a foe and touch them, spreading ice across their body. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll} against a foe within your reach, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[cold]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double cold damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 5}.

Success You deal normal cold damage and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3}.

Failure You only graze the target, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[cold]] damage and causing the target to be @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}.

Critical Failure Your touch misses completely, and the target is unharmed.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8, or 1 on a failure.

Glacial Curtain.name: Glacial Curtain
Glacial Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of cold across the battlefield, chilling those who cross it. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of cold up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet} long in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[cold]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes cold damage from Glacial Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Glacier.name: Glacier
Glacier.description:
You drop a glacier onto the battlefield, devastating and freezing over your foes. The glacier falls on creatures in a @Template[type:burst|distance:40]{40-foot radius} with a center within 120 feet; the glacier initially appears 40 feet above the center point, damaging creatures within a vertical cylinder 40 feet high with a radius of 40 feet.

Creatures in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[cold],(1+@actor.level)[bludgeoning]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 4}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 5}.

Level (+1) The cold damage increases by 1d4 and the bludgeoning damage increases by 1.

Gloaming Backstab.name: Gloaming Backstab
Gloaming Backstab.description:
You sink into the shadows and stab your foe in the back with a blade of pure darkness. You deal @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[cold]] damage to a foe within reach. The results depend on your @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll}. If you're shrouded and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the foe, you deal an additional 2d4 precision damage plus 1d4 precision damage for every level you have, and the shrouded condition ends after the attack. Otherwise, you become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Success You deal double cold damage (and precision damage, if any).

Success You deal normal cold damage (and precision damage, if any).

Failure Your backstab misses, but the darkness still falls upon them. They take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[cold]] damage; the precision damage doesn't apply.

Critical Failure Your backstab misses completely, and the target is unharmed.

Level (+1) The cold damage increases by 1d6, or 1 on a failure and the precision damage increases by 1d4.

Gloom Burst.name: Gloom Burst
Gloom Burst.description:
You create an outpouring of gloom, damaging foes and shrouding allies. The gloom spreads in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet.

Foes in the burst take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[cold]] damage with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Allies in the burst (and you, if you are in the burst) take no damage and are @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn. If you were already shrouded when you used Gloom Burst, you can choose to spread the gloom in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:40] instead of a @Template[type:burst|distance:20].

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half cold damage.

Failure The creature takes full cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of your next turn.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Grasp of the Hungry Earth.name: Grasp of the Hungry Earth
Grasp of the Hungry Earth.description:
Requirements You are standing on a solid surface

You detach earth from your body into the ground in a single direction to clutch nearby foes and hinder their movements. Choose one of your space's four sides. All foes adjacent to you along that side (typically up to three foes if you are Medium, four foes if you are Large, and so on) take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[bludgeoning]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is partially ensnared. It can't Step as long as it is adjacent to you along the side you chose, and all of those spaces are difficult terrain to it; these effects last until the beginning of your next turn, or until it [[/act escape]]{Escapes} against your power DC, whichever comes first.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage from the earth's grasp and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the beginning of the next turn or until it Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Healing Motes.description:
You send out glowing motes of healing energy, which latch onto your choice of either all living and undead creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], or a single living or undead creature within 30 feet. If you target only a single creature, two motes latch onto that creature.

When a living creature with one or more motes takes damage, they receive an amount of simultaneous @Damage[(2+(2*@actor.level))[healing]]{healing} equal to 2 plus twice your level, up to a maximum of the damage taken, as normal for a recovery effect. One mote on the creature then vanishes.

When an undead creature with one or more motes takes damage, they also take @Damage[(2+(2*@actor.level))[vitality]] damage from the mote, and then one mote on the undead creature vanishes. Motes otherwise last until your next turn. Undead receive a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save to attempt to avoid the motes in the first place, with the following effects.

Critical Success The undead entirely avoids the mote.

Success The mote grazes the undead, and they take half the vitality damage from the mote.

Failure The mote attaches to the undead, and they take full damage from the mote.

Critical Failure The mote lands in an especially vulnerable spot for the undead, and they take double damage from the mote.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.1gnFsjdwbgl3jYjT]{Effect: Healing Mote}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 2.
Healing Motes.name: Healing Motes

Heart of Darkness.name: Heart of Darkness
Heart of Darkness.description:
You call forth a pulsing heart of darkness which pulses and explodes in a massive burst. The heart appears within 500 feet and explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30], dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[cold]] damage to each creature in the area, depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

As long as any foes take damage, your heart surges with the power of darkness, and you become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} and gain a +1 status bonus on all saving throws and skill checks, which both last until the end of your next turn.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 3} until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.idVFUK9JA6hklgE7]{Effect: Heart of Darkness}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Hidden in the Mist.name: Hidden in the Mist
Hidden in the Mist.description: You create a cloud of vaporous mist in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] which lasts until the end of your next turn, and you can then attempt to Hide within the mist. All creatures within the mist become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become concealed to creatures within it. You can see through the mist normally, and if you have wavesense, it applies within the mist, even if you aren't underwater. You Refresh your powers, which allows you to change to your choice of high tide or low tide.

High Voltage.name: High Voltage
High Voltage.description:
As you refresh your electricity, you build a huge electric potential, shocking the first creature to attack you. Before the beginning of your next turn, the first time an adjacent creature hits you with a melee attack, a creature touches you (such as when using a touch range spell), or a creature hits you with a melee unarmed attack or a melee attack with a metal weapon, that creature takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[electricity]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

As usual for such effects, it occurs only when a creature touches or hits you, not when you touch or hit the creature. After the electricity discharges once, even if the creature critically succeeds at its Reflex save and takes no damage, no further creatures take electricity damage. You Refresh your powers.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Hurricane Downdraft.name: Hurricane Downdraft
Hurricane Downdraft.description:
You bring down hurricane force winds that slice through your foes and knock down those who dare challenge you in the sky. The downdraft is a vertical cylinder with your choice of radius from 5 feet to 15 feet and your choice of height from 40 feet to 200 feet, and the pillar's top center must be within 500 feet of you, but the bottom or far side of the pillar can extend out of range. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[slashing]] to each creature in the area, with results depending on their @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. Forced movement from Hurricane Downdraft doesn't cause falling damage, even if it causes the creature to reach the ground.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The hurricane wind grazes the creature, and pushes it down slightly if it was flying. The creature takes half damage, and is pushed 10 feet down toward the ground if it's flying.

Failure The hurricane wind solidly cuts into the creature and pushes it down if it was flying. The creature takes full damage, and if it's flying, it's pushed to the bottom of the cylinder, or to the ground, whichever it reaches first.

Critical Failure The hurricane wind horribly wounds the creature and knocks it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} to the ground. The creature takes double damage. If it's flying, the hurricane pushes it to the ground. Whether or not the creature is flying, it falls prone.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Hydro Bullet.name: Hydro Bullet
Hydro Bullet.description:
You shoot a powerful bullet of water at a foe. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{ranged power attack roll} against a foe within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d4[bludgeoning]] damage.

High Tide: The damage increases to @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage in exchange for significant recoil. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until your next turn.

Low Tide: The bullet originates from somewhere within 60 feet of you and flies back toward you. You still can't use Hydro Bullet against a target with total cover, and you need line of effect to the bullet's origin point, but this might allow the bullet to ignore other types of cover by attacking from a different direction.

Critical Success You deal double bludgeoning damage to the foe, and you move the foe 20 feet.

Success You deal normal bludgeoning damage to the foe, and you move the foe 10 feet.

Failure The foe can't avoid being grazed unless they move along with the bullet. Your foe chooses whether to take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[bludgeoning]] damage or to let you move it 5 feet.

Critical Failure The bullet misses completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4, or 1d8 on high tide.

Hyperion.name: Hyperion
Hyperion.description:
You call upon the mythical solar chariot to bring forth the light of truth. Bright light shines within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] for 1 minute, attempting to counteract all illusions and transformations (except illusions from your light powers) within the area, using your power DC – 10 as your counteract modifier and half your level rounded up as your counteract level. a successful counteract check reveals the truth within Hyperion's area, rather than ending the effects. The light counteracts preexisting illusions and new illusions brought into the area alike.

Foes that start their turn in the area take @Damage[(@actor.level)[fire]] damage and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} while in the area and until the end of their turn once they leave the area and @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of their next turn. You and your allies gain a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls against foes limned by Hyperion.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Ice Armor.name: Ice Armor
Ice Armor.description:
You cover yourself in a protective layer of ice as you refresh your ice elemental power. You become frozen 2 and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC and temporary Hit Points equal to your level. You Refresh your powers. The ice melts quickly thereafter.

At the beginning of your next turn, your frozen condition from Ice Armor is reduced to frozen 1, and your circumstance bonus to AC is reduced to +1. At the beginning of your turn after that, the frozen condition from Ice Armor, AC bonus, and any remaining temporary Hit Points expire.

Ice Shield.name: Ice Shield
Ice Shield.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack and you can see the attacker.

You quickly protect yourself with a shield of ice, which freezes you over. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against the attack roll and until the end of the current creature's turn, and you gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level that last until the end of the current creature's turn. You become frozen 1.

Ice Tomb.name: Ice Tomb
Ice Tomb.description:
You manipulate the rime surrounding a frozen foe, entombing them within the ice until they break free. Choose a creature with the frozen condition from your ice powers within 60 feet. The target is affected depending on its @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} as long as it remains frozen by your ice powers. If it ever ends the frozen condition, it's no longer immobilized, even if you later give it the frozen condition again.

Failure As success, except the target is additionally @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3} and as long as it remains immobilized by Ice Tomb, the only actions it can take are Interact actions to remove the frozen condition.

Critical Failure As success, except the target is additionally @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 5} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}, and as long as it remains immobilized by Ice Tomb, the only actions it can take are Interact actions to remove the frozen condition.

Icicle.name: Icicle
Icicle.description:
You fire an icicle at your foe. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{ranged power attack roll} against a foe within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[((2+@actor.level)d4)[cold],(2+@actor.level)[piercing]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double cold damage to the target, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 4}.

Success You deal normal cold damage to the target, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}.

Failure The icicle passes near the creature, and the lingering chill causes the target to take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[cold]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 1}.

Critical Failure The icicle misses completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4, or 1 on a failure.

Level (+2) The normal damage increases by 1.

Ignite.name: Ignite
Ignite.description:
You light your foe on fire, setting them ablaze. You deal @Damage[(@actor.level*2)[persistent,fire]] damage to a target within 30 feet, with an effect based on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half persistent fire damage.

Failure The creature takes full persistent fire damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes full persistent fire damage and burns immediately for @Damage[(4*@actor.level)[fire]].

Level (+1) The damage increases by 2.

Illuminate Weakness.name: Illuminate Weakness
Illuminate Weakness.description:
You bring forth a light that shines on your foe's weakest points, making it easy for you and your allies to damage the foe. Choose a foe within 60 feet. You deal the foe @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success You deal half damage to the foe, and the foe is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn. During that time, you and your allies add 2 additional precision damage with your Strikes against the target as long as it remains limned, and you add 4 additional precision damage with your light powers against the target. At 11th level, the precision damage increases to 3 for Strikes and 6 for your light powers, at 15th level, it increases to 4 for Strikes and 8 for your light powers, and at 19th level it increases to 5 for Strikes and 10 for your light powers.

Failure As success, but you deal full fire damage to the foe.

Critical Failure As success, but you deal double fire damage to the foe, and the limned condition and precision damage last until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Gmnf0LY2NP8fTcC4]{Effect: Illuminate Weakness}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Illuminating Pulse.name: Illuminating Pulse
Illuminating Pulse.description: You release a pulse of light that illuminates everything around you, revealing what was @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} and recharging your light power. Everything in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn). You Refresh your powers.

Immortal Water Dragon.description:
You form a long serpentine dragon that twists and turns, slamming into foes and pushing them toward or away from you, regardless of the dragon's current direction. The dragon is Large, starts in your space if you're in high tide or in a space of your choice within 120 feet if you're in low tide, and swims in a 120-foot long path of your choice, ending in your space if you're in low tide. All foes in the dragon's path take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[bludgeoning]] damage, depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. Creatures are only affected by the dragon once, even if its path crosses over them multiple times.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage and you ride the dragon, moving along with it but losing your balance. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Low Tide: The dragon ends its movement in your space, where it guards you. You gain greater cover from the dragon until the end of your next turn or until you move out of the dragon's space, whichever comes first. The dragon doesn't provide cover to anyone else.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage and you move them 5 feet.

Failure The foe takes full damage and you move them 10 feet.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and you move them 20 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or 1d8 in high tide.
Immortal Water Dragon.name: Immortal Water Dragon

Implant Taboo.name: Implant Taboo
Implant Taboo.description:
Trigger A foe within 60 feet takes a move action, takes an attack action, takes a skill action, casts a spell, or uses an activity containing a move action, an attack action, a skill action, or a spell.

You tap into your foe's mind and make their choice of action feel like an unforgivable taboo, potentially forcing the creature to change their action. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe feels uneasy about their actions and hesitates. They can choose to either become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} or to take the effects of failure.

Failure The foe can't bring themself to take the triggering action, or a similar action. The foe must choose a different action instead, and they can't use another corresponding action this turn (a move action, attack action, skill action, or spell). If the trigger was an activity that contained more than one of the above types of action, choose one of them to become taboo. The reaction occurs before the foe spends their actions, so they don't lose any actions when they pivot to a new action.

Critical Failure As failure, but the foe wastes 1 action hesitating over the taboo; even if the trigger was a two-action activity or a three-action activity, the foe only wastes 1 action.

Imprison in Thorns.name: Imprison in Thorns
Imprison in Thorns.description:
You imprison your foe in living thorns. Choose a foe within 60 feet. The target is affected depending on its Reflex save. Any Interact actions to remove the prison or attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} the prison cause the creature attempting the action to take @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))[piercing]] damage.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around your target. 
  • Harvest: You harvest either in the foe's space or in an adjacent square to increase the thorn prison's effects. Interact actions to remove the prison or attempts to Escape the prison cause the creature attempting the action to take piercing damage equal to your level, instead of half your level.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is only slightly imprisoned. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it, or another adjacent creature, spends an Interact action to remove the prison.

Failure The target is imprisoned more deeply. The target is immobilized until it, or another adjacent creature, spends a total of two Interact actions to remove the prison, or until the target successfully Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first. A failed Escape substitutes for one of the Interact actions needed to remove the prison. The only actions the target can take are Interact or Escape actions to remove the prison.

Critical Failure As failure, except it takes four Interact actions or a successful Escape against your power DC, instead of two.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Incandescent Guardian.name: Incandescent Guardian
Incandescent Guardian.description:
You conjure an incandescent guardian that clings to a foe, damaging them and revealing their attacks. Choose a foe within 120 feet. You deal @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success You deal half fire damage to the foe, and the foe is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn. You can choose to deal no fire damage to the foe instead of half damage; if you choose to do so, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the foe until the end of your next turn, as long as it remains limned.

Failure You deal full fire damage to the foe, and the foe is limned until the end of your next turn. During that time, as long as it remains limned, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the foe.

Critical Failure You deal double fire damage to the foe, and the foe is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn). During that time, as long as it remains limned, you and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the foe.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Ei9t00REcjAiEnmM]{Effect: Incandescent Guardian}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Ineluctable Flight.name: Ineluctable Flight
Ineluctable Flight.description:
As you gather and arrange the ambient air energy, almost nothing can stop you from moving. Choose a location you can see within 100 feet. You float on the winds to that location, ignoring difficult terrain, greater difficult terrain, hazardous terrain, and other similar terrain effects.

Since you're flying on the winds, you can move to locations that are hard to reach, even if you ordinarily couldn't walk to them. You can't move through completely solid objects, but you can fit through tiny cracks like a creature using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Vapor Form}. Your movement doesn't trigger reactions or free actions of any kind (even those that aren't triggered by movement).

You Refresh your powers.

Inexorable Demise.name: Inexorable Demise
Inexorable Demise.description:
You call upon the eventual inexorable demise of all living things, hanging a creature's death over them like a sword of Damocles until they face the reaper's scythe. Three ominous skulls appear over the head of a creature you choose within 60 feet. At the end of each of the creature's turns, a mournful bell tolls as one of the skulls burns up and disappears. After the last skull disappears, a scythe of void energy reaps the creature's life force, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d12[void]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. You can cancel the effect and spare the creature at any time before the last skull disappears by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.laqtHcTDdj2GdjpC]{Effect: Inexorable Demise}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d12.

Inferno.name: Inferno
Inferno.description:
You bring forth a widespread inferno across multiple areas nearby. Flames burn and consume creatures within up to six @Template[type:burst|distance:10]{10-foot radius bursts} all within 120 feet. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[fire]] damage, as well as @Damage[(4+(floor(@actor.level/2)))[persistent,fire]]{persistent fire} damage equal to 4 plus half your level to all creatures in the area, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. Even if a creature is in the area of multiple bursts, they still only take damage once.

Level (+1) The normal damage increases by 1d4.

Infused Ground.name: Infused Ground
Infused Ground.description: You infuse the ground around you with elemental energy, transforming it into hazardous terrain as you manipulate the energy to refresh your powers. You Refresh your powers. Until the beginning of your next turn, the ground in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] becomes hazardous terrain, dealing @Damage[4[untyped]] damage of your element's associated type. At 14th level, the damage increases to @Damage[5[untyped]], at 17th level, it increases to @Damage[6[untyped]], and at 20th level, it increases to @Damage[7[untyped]].

Intensify Cold.name: Intensify Cold
Intensify Cold.description: You connect yourself into the cold air around you and the frozen foes you've chilled. All foes within 30 feet with the frozen condition from your ice powers must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC or increase their frozen condition by 3, or 1 on a success, and 0 on a critical success. Unfrozen foes in the area that are within 10 feet of either you or a frozen foe must succeed at a Fortitude save against your power DC or become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 1}. You Refresh your powers.

Intensify Glare.name: Intensify Glare
Intensify Glare.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet succeeds at a flat check from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} condition caused by your light powers.

You intensify the glare from your light at the last second, throwing off the creature's attack even more. The creature must roll the flat check from the dazzled condition again and take the second result. The DC of the second @Check[type:flat|dc:7] check increases from 5 to 7.

Intrusive Analysis.description:
You intrude into your foe's mind, damaging them and allowing you to predict their every action for a short time. Choose a foe within 60 feet. They take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[mental]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your AC and saves against the foe until the beginning of your next turn.

Failure The foe takes full damage and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your power attack rolls, AC, and saves against the foe until you refresh.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your power attack rolls, AC, and saves against the foe until you refresh.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.6HeqeFhufTRavbAF]{Effect: Intrusive Analysis}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
Intrusive Analysis.name: Intrusive Analysis

Irkalla.name: Irkalla
Irkalla.description: You call upon a portion of the underworld as the ground around you fades to a wispy and ominous white. The area on the ground within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] becomes an annex of the underworld for 1 minute. Your foes take @Damage[20[void]] damage at the start of each of their turns in the area. A foe who takes damage in this way is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (your choice) for 1 round. The area is also hazardous terrain to your foes, dealing @Damage[2[void]] damage for every square that the foe enters.

Jolting Embrace.description:
You surround yourself with electricity in order to shock all those who dare attack you. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[@actor.level[electricity]] damage and then become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} for 1 round. Choose one:

  • You either become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Bi2aHykg6CZrQCnR]{Charged}
  • You discharge to increase the damage to @Damage[(1d6+@actor.level)[electricty]]; this improves to @Damage[(1d8+@actor.level)[electricty]] at 12th level, @Damage[(1d10+@actor.level)[electricty]] at 15th level, and @Damage[(1d12+@actor.level)[electricty]] at 18th level.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.
Jolting Embrace.name: Jolting Embrace

Jumbling Threads.name: Jumbling Threads
Jumbling Threads.description:
You spray threads of force in a cone, assailing your foes and jumbling them through the area. You deal @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4 +ceil(@actor.level/2))[force]] damage to all foes in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the cone to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20] when you use Jumbling Threads, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the cone by 5 additional feet, to a maximum of 35 feet at 17th level.

Allies in the cone take no damage, and if they're willing, you can reposition them up to 10 feet to another space within the cone.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and you can reposition them up to 5 feet to another space within the cone.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and you can reposition them up to 10 feet to another space within the cone.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Kamaitachi.name: Kamaitachi
Kamaitachi.description:
You conjure a powerful flensing dust devil with the vicious tenacity of a legendary weasel. The dust devil appears within 1,000 feet, occupies a 15-foot by 15-foot area, similar to the size of a Huge creature, and lasts until you refresh. Just after using this power, and then again at the beginning of each of your turns, you can use a free action, which has the concentrate trait, to move the dust devil up to 60 feet in any direction, including vertically, though the dust devil dies out if it ever moves more than 1,000 feet from your position. All foes that come within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] of the dust devil take @Damage[floor(@actor.level/2)d10[slashing]] damage with a @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save; they take damage only once per round, regardless of how many times they come near the dust devil. If the dust devil intersects with an ally's space during its movement, and the ally is willing, the dust devil can lift the ally up, depositing them in one of the spaces when it ends its movement. The dust devil can lift up to 1 Huge ally, 2 Large allies, or 4 Medium or smaller allies at a time.

Level (20th) The damage increases by 1d10.

Killing Embrace.name: Killing Embrace
Killing Embrace.description:
You surround yourself with a pall of death, forcing those who attack you to pay with their life. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[@actor.level[void]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (your choice) until the end of their turn.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Kunlun.name: Kunlun
Kunlun.description:
You call forth a small mountain in the shape of an enormous magnificent pillar that towers into the sky, with a gemlike facade adorned with symbols of mysticism and elemental energy. The pillar emerges from the ground within 200 feet and lasts for 1 minute. It has a @Template[type:burst|distance:60]{60-foot radius), with a height of your choosing, up to 180 feet if used in an open area, or just tall enough not to crush creatures atop the pillar if used in a space with a confined ceiling. Creatures in the area are lifted rapidly as the mountain grows.

Foes on the ascending pillar must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC or fall @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} from the sudden motion. You can choose whether to have all such creatures slam into the ceiling, if any, taking @Damage[20d6[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against your power DC, or to gently slow down the ascent just before it reaches the ceiling. The pillar's Climb DC is 20.

Lambent Reflection.description:
You call two mirrors and then fire a stream of light, bouncing off the mirrors to redirect it up to twice. The stream takes the form of a @Template[type:line|distance:240], except you can cause the line to turn up to 90 degrees twice at the points on its length with mirrors. Foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. A foe that was already limned takes a –2 circumstance penalty to their Reflex save. Even if the path intersects a foe multiple times, they only take damage once.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is dazzled and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
Lambent Reflection.name: Lambent Reflection

Lantern of Revelation.name: Lantern of Revelation
Lantern of Revelation.description:
You emit a sphere of revealing light, searing those within with the truth. The sphere forms in a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet. Creatures in the burst take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Lantern of Revelation attempts to counteract illusions and effects that disguise a creature's true form on every creature that becomes limned by Lantern of Revelation, using your power DC – 10 as your counteract modifier and half your level rounded up as your counteract level. On a success, Lantern of Revelation doesn't end the counteracted effect but instead temporarily reveals the true nature behind the illusion or transformation for all to see as long as they remain limned by Lantern of Revelation.

Lantern of Revelation also attempts to counteract illusions in the area that aren't on a specific creature, surrounding them in light and revealing their true nature until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn). You can choose not to counteract your own illusions within the Lantern of Revelation; to you, they represent their own form of truth.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage as is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Lethal Curtain.name: Lethal Curtain
Lethal Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of death across the battlefield, snuffing out the lives of those who cross it. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of death up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet} long in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet.

Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[void]] damage, and the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of their turn. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes void damage from Lethal Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Life Conductor.name: Life Conductor
Life Conductor.description:
You take control of all healing and rejuvenation around you. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level, which last until you refresh. Whenever a living creature within 60 feet regains Hit Points (whether from healing magic, fast healing, regeneration, or some other means) or gains temporary Hit Points, you can choose to redirect half the healing or temporary Hit Points to a different target of your choice within 60 feet who did not gain any healing from the same effect.

If the originator of the healing is not willing to allow this, you must succeed at a counteract check, with a counteract modifier equal to your power DC – 10 and a counteract level equal to half your level rounded up, in order to do so. Your ability to control healing lasts until you refresh.

Life Rebound.name: Life Rebound
Life Rebound.description: You protect your ally from harm by causing their spent life force to stretch and rebound back to them for a fleeting moment to help them survive a follow-up attack. Choose a living creature within 30 feet. Until the next time you refresh, whenever that creature takes damage and loses actual Hit Points (not temporary Hit Points), they gain temporary Hit Points equal to the number of actual Hit Points they lost, or twice your level, whichever is lower. These temporary Hit Points only last until the end of the current creature's turn.

Life Shackles.description:
You cause your foes' life force to congeal around them into shackles, holding them down. Living foes within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] are affected depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save and their current Hit Points.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe is slightly shackled by their own life force. If at maximum Hit Points, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}, and otherwise they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}. They can reduce or remove the stunned condition's value by an amount of their choice by choosing to lose a number of Hit Points equal to your level × the amount they wish to reduce the stunned value.

Failure As success, but the shackles are tighter, so the foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 4} if they're below half their maximum Hit Points, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 5} if above half their maximum Hit Points, and stunned 6 if they're at their maximum Hit Points.

Critical Failure As failure, but the shackles of life are extremely tight, and they lose a number of Hit Points equal to twice your level × the amount they wish to reduce the stunned value.
Life Shackles.name: Life Shackles

Lifeguard Bubble.description:
You create a glowing bubble that prevents leaking life energy from departing. The bubble exists in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around you, and creatures can move in and out of the bubble effortlessly; it only traps leaking life energy. Keep track of any actual Hit Points (not temporary Hit Points) that you and your allies lose while within the bubble.

The bubble pops at the beginning of your next turn, or just before you or an ally in the bubble would reach 0 Hit Points, whichever comes first. When the bubble pops, you can heal a total of @Damage[(7+(@actor.level*7))[healing]] Hit Points, which you can distribute however you like among yourself and the allies within the bubble. As normal for a recovery effect, this can't heal an individual creature for more Hit Points than they lost while the bubble was active.

Level (+1) The healing increases by 7.
Lifeguard Bubble.name: Lifeguard Bubble

Lifestorm.name: Lifestorm
Lifestorm.description:
You call forth a vibrant storm of glowing vital energy that rains down from the sky above. The lifestorm fills a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet of you. If you (if you are living) or a living ally enter or start your turn in the area, you gain [[/r 10+@actor.level]] temporary Hit Points equal to 10 plus your level which last for 1 round, and undead creatures that enter or start their turn in the area take the same amount of @Damage[ (10+@actor.level)[vitality]] damage. The lifestorm lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes vitality damage or gains temporary Hit Points from Lifestorm once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the area and then enters the area.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Liquefy Air.name: Liquefy Air
Liquefy Air.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with a ranged attack and you can see the attacker.

You liquefy the air between you and the creature. If it's physical, the triggering attack's ranged increment is halved, and it takes a –2 circumstance penalty if the attack was bludgeoning or slashing. The reduced range increment could result in you being beyond the attack's maximum range, in which case it automatically misses you without rolling an attack roll. You gain resistance equal to your level against acid and fire damage from the triggering attack. While your tide has no effect on this power, it still changes your tide.

Special If you're underwater, the power makes the water more viscous instead, increasing the circumstance penalty to –4 and extending the penalty and the range increment reduction to all ranged weapon attacks and ranged unarmed attacks, even if they aren't physical. However, the range increment reduction from the power isn't cumulative with the normal reduction to range increment for piercing ranged attacks underwater.

Locomotion Shred.name: Locomotion Shred
Locomotion Shred.description:
You wrap threads of force around your foe, damaging it whenever it moves. Choose a foe within 100 feet, causing it to potentially take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[force]] damage for each 5-foot square it moved during that movement, depending on its @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. At 15th level, the damage increases to an amount of @Damage[(3+@actor.level)[force]] damage when it moves equal to your level plus 3 damage for each 5-foot square it moved.

Critical Success The foe avoids that threads of force and is unaffected.

Success The threads of force barely snag the foe before falling off. The next time it uses a move action before the end of its next turn, it takes force damage from Locomotion Shred.

Failure The threads of force stick to the foe. It takes force damage from Locomotion Shred on its first move action of each turn until the next time you refresh. Additionally, if you reposition the target with a force power, it takes force damage equal to your level.

Critical Failure The threads become completely enmeshed around the foe. It takes force damage from Locomotion Shred on every move action until the next time you refresh. Additionally, if you reposition the target with a force power, it takes force damage equal to twice your level.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.
Level (15h) The damage increases to 3 plus your level for each 5-foot square it moved.

Lucent Beam.name: Lucent Beam
Lucent Beam.description:
You emit a beam of light to dazzle foes in a line. You deal an amount of fire damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4+(ceil(@actor.level/2)))[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:30], with results depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the line to a @Template[type:line|distance:40]{40 feet} when you use Lucent Beam, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the line by 10 additional feet, to a maximum of @Template[type:line|distance:70]{70 feet} at 17th level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full fire damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and limned until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The creature takes double fire damage and is dazzled and limned until the end of your turn after next (for 2 rounds and then until the end of your turn).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Meteor.name: Meteor
Meteor.description:
You send down a meteor from above, shattering and exploding on your foes at an enormous range.

The meteor strikes down in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 500 feet, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[bludgeoning]] damage to each creature in the area and explodes, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage to each creature in the area.

Creatures in the area make a single @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save against all the damage from the meteor.

Level (+1) The bludgeoning damage is increased by 1.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Midnight Orb.name: Midnight Orb
Midnight Orb.description:
You fire off an orb of midnight at a foe. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{ranged power attack roll} against a foe within 60 feet, dealing an amount of cold damage equal to @Damage[((2+@actor.level)d4 + ceil(@actor.level /2))[cold]] damage.

At 7th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, your orb's range increases by 30 feet, to a maximum of 180 feet at 19th level. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on the attack roll if you're shrouded.

Critical Success You deal double cold damage to the target and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 2} until the end of your next turn.

Success You deal normal cold damage to the target and the target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The orb misses but still manages to shroud the target. The target is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The orb misses completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Mjollnir.name: Mjollnir
Mjollnir.description:
You hurl a hammer of lightning into the air, where it floats, up to 120 feet away laterally and up to 60 feet above the ground. At the end of each of your turns, the hammer shoots lightning at all your foes below it vertically and within 60 feet laterally, dealing @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))d12[electricity]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. The hammer lasts until you refresh.

Level (20th) The damage increases by 1d12.

Nabu.name: Nabu
Nabu.description:
You call upon a mythical font of knowledge and origin of writing, assailing your foes all at once with a torrent of overwhelming information. Creatures you choose within 120 feet take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[mental]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} until the end of your next turn and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until you refresh.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} until the end of your next turn and stupefied 2 until you refresh.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Muspell.name: Muspell
Muspell.description:
You selectively juxtapose the world around you with the wellspring of elemental fire, burning away all that displeases you. The world within 500 feet momentarily seems to flicker away, replaced with only fire as far as the eye can see.

Creatures you choose within the range take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save to avoid the world around them being drawn for an instant into the realm of fire.

Nature Overwhelming.name: Nature Overwhelming
Nature Overwhelming.description:
You infuse your foe with wood elemental energy, overwhelming them and either sowing dense verdure or harvesting to stack masses of plant matter onto them to stun them. Choose a creature within 90 feet. The target takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the creature, including in the creature's space, creating dense and brightly colored plants that greatly obstruct movement. The area is greater difficult terrain, instead of normal difficult terrain. When you harvest these dense plants, creatures with the plants in their space become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round. 
  • Harvest: You harvest plants in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around the creature, including in the creature's space, in order to stun them. The Fortitude save effects change from a basic Fortitude save to the following.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage, and the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} as long as you harvested at least three squares of plants.

Failure The creature takes full damage and it's stunned with a stunned value equal to 1 for every three squares of plants you harvested, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} if you harvested at least nine squares.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature takes double damage and the maximum stunned condition is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 5} if you harvested at least fifteen squares.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Nyctophobia.name: Nyctophobia
Nyctophobia.description:
You overwhelm a foe with their fear of the unknown that lies within the darkness. Choose a foe within 120 feet. The foe becomes frightened and shrouded and takes @Damage[@actor.level[cold,persistent]] damage, depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. Creatures with greater darkvision gain a +2 circumstance bonus on their saving throw, and creatures without darkvision or low-light vision take a –2 circumstance penalty on their saving throw.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half persistent cold damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.
