Foes that enter or start their turn in the area take @Damage[ceil(@actor.level/2)d6[slashing]] damage, Flying in the area is difficult terrain for your foes, and your foes's physical ranged attacks that pass through the area take a –2 circumstance penalty to their attack rolls unless they use unusually massive projectiles. The tempest lasts until you refresh. A creature only takes slashing damage from Tempest once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the area and then enters the area.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Tendrils of Shade.name: Tendrils of Shade
Tendrils of Shade.description:
You send forth tendrils of shade in a cone to chill your foes and shroud yourself. You deal an amount of cold damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4 +ceil(@actor.level /2))[cold]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save, and then you become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the cone to a @Template[type:cone|distance:20] when you use Tendrils of Shade, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the cone by 5 additional feet, to a maximum of 35 feet at 17th level. If you're shrouded, you can extend the tendrils by up to 10 additional feet (25 feet at 1st level, 45 feet at 17th level).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Tezcatlipoca.name: Tezcatlipoca
Tezcatlipoca.description: You call forth a mythical jaguar of obsidian darkness, slashing through all your foes with hundreds of obsidian claws and leaching away their light. Creatures you choose within 200 feet take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[cold]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save, and those that fail their save are @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.Item.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn.

Thanatos.name: Thanatos
Thanatos.description:
You call upon an embodiment of death, the reaper of all life, to slay all who oppose you. Everything fades into white, as a skeletal figure descends upon your enemies.

Creatures you choose within 200 feet take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[void]] damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and must attempt a second @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|traits:incapacitation] save. On a failure, they instantly die. This second Fortitude save is a death and incapacitation effect.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Throw Everything.name: Throw Everything
Throw Everything.description:
If there was an unattended object nearby that you didn't fling, it's just because you didn't notice it. You throw everything. Make @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack rolls} against any number of creatures within 60 feet as you pummel them with various objects, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[untyped]] damage, of whichever of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage is most advantageous, depending on your power attack roll.

Since you're throwing so many different objects, special materials like silver or adamantine typically don't apply (unlike the Object Throw power), though at the GM's discretion if you are surrounded by only objects of one material, they might apply.

Don't apply your multiple attack penalty until after all the attacks.

Critical Success The creature takes double damage.

Success The creature takes full damage.

Failure The creature takes half damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes no damage.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Tornado.name: Tornado
Tornado.description:
You call up a brief but powerful tornado, spinning around and rending your foes while safely maneuvering yourself and your allies. The tornado spins in a @Template[type:burst|distance:40] within 120 feet. Foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[slashing]], with results depending on their @Check[type:Fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. You can move willing allies in the area (and yourself, if you're in the area) to any space in the area the same distance from the center of the area as their original space. For instance, if an ally was 30 feet south of the center of the area, you could spin them to be 30 feet northwest of the center of the area instead. This doesn't move them vertically.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected by the tornado.

Success The tornado makes a few incidental cuts, but the foe withstands the worst of it. The foe takes half damage from the tornado.

Failure The tornado cuts into the foe and carries them along. The foe takes full damage from the tornado and you can move them up to 10 feet to a space the same distance from the center of the area as their original space. This doesn't move them vertically.

Critical Failure The tornado cuts deeply into the foe as it picks them up and spins them around and around. The foe takes double damage from the tornado and you can move them to any space the same distance from the center of the area as their original space. This doesn't move them vertically.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Trail Blaze.name: Trail Blaze
Trail Blaze.description:
You alight with flame, rushing forward and leaving behind a trail of fire to burn your foes. You either Stride or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through}, leaving behind flames in any space you enter during the movement, which last until the end of your next turn.

Creatures who start their turn in the flames or pass through the flames take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage. A creature only takes fire damage from Trail Blaze once, even if it starts its turn in the fire and then crosses the fire, or crosses the fire several times.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Tremor Stomp.name: Tremor Stomp
Tremor Stomp.description:
Requirements You are standing on a solid surface

You stomp and infuse earth energy into the ground, creating a localized tremor. You deal @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[bludgeoning]] damage to all creatures standing on the same solid surface in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5], with effects depending on their Fortitude save.

At 9th level, you can choose to increase the size of the emanation to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] when you use Tremor Stomp, and at 17th level, you can also choose to increase it to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15].

Critical Success The creature is unaffected

Success The creature takes half damage and their footing is unsteady, causing them to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the beginning of their next turn.

Failure The creature takes full damage and their footing is unsteady, causing them to become off-guard until the beginning of their next turn. It takes a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against creatures other than you for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. It takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against creatures other than you for 1 round.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Umbral Call.description:
You call forth darkness you can use to refresh your darkness powers. You Refresh your powers.

Then the area in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] around you becomes darkness until the end of your next turn. Light doesn't enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, don't emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the area. Magical light can attempt to counteract the darkness as normal. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside without darkvision. From outside, the area of darkness appears as a sphere of pure darkness.
Umbral Call.name: Umbral Call

Umbral Curtain.name: Umbral Curtain
Umbral Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of darkness across the battlefield, enshrouding those who cross it. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of darkness up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet} long in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. The curtain is dark and blocks light; only creatures with darkvision can see the other side of the curtain.

Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[cold]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of its next turn. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes cold damage from Umbral Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Unrelenting Jet.name: Unrelenting Jet
Unrelenting Jet.description:
You call forth an orb of water that fires a continuous jet against a foe, attempting to prevent it from approaching or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}. You deal @Damage[(max((1+@actor.level),6))d4[bludgeoning]] damage to a single foe within 60 feet, with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(max((1+@actor.level),6))d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage, but you take a –2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.

Low Tide: The target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn unless they critically succeed at their saving throw.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage and moving against the jet (toward you for high tide, or away from you for low tide) is difficult terrain for them for 1 round.

Failure The target takes full damage, you move the target 5 feet, and moving against the jet (toward you for high tide, or away from you for low tide) is greater difficult terrain for them for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, you move the target 10 feet, and it can't move against the jet (toward you for high tide, or away from you for low tide) for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.s7OtrwAXwaGWVT10]{Effect: Unrelenting Jet (High Tide)}

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Be68woo4zufVqnxc]{Effect: Unrelenting Jet (Low Tide)}

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d4, or 1d8 on high tide.

Vajra.name: Vajra
Vajra.description:
You call forth a legendary indestructible and irresistible lightning bolt and thrust it forward at your foes, releasing a massive bolt. All foes in a @Template[type:line|distance:2000|width:30]{30-foot wide line up to 2,000 feet long} are electrocuted, taking @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[electricity]] damage.

This electricity damage is truly irresistible. It ignores resistance, and even creatures immune to electricity are affected, taking force damage instead of electricity damage.

Creatures can't dodge the lightning, and their bodies can't hope to withstand it, but an unbreakable will allows a foe to deny the lightning bolt's legend and mitigate the effects. The results depend on the foe's @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The electricity might be irresistible, but the foe's will is so unassailable that they only take minor damage. The foe takes @Damage[ (floor(@actor.level/2))[electricity]] damage.

Success The foe takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.1fZbuJEbVmE3J4XL]{Shocked} for 2 rounds.

Failure The foe takes full damage and is shocked for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and is shocked for 1 minute and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Vanishing Silhouette.name: Vanishing Silhouette
Vanishing Silhouette.description:
You send forth a silhouette of darkness that resembles your own shadow, while shrouding yourself and immediately hiding as the silhouette distracts your target. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[cold]] damage to a creature within 120 feet, with effects depending on your @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{ranged power attack roll}. You become @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.SXQzSmgPZv0IFSlN]{Shrouded 1} until the end of your next turn and then you Hide.

Critical Success The creature takes double cold damage.

Success The creature takes full cold damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[cold]] cold damage.

Critical Failure The silhouette misses completely.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or 1 on a failure.

Vengeful Backlash.name: Vengeful Backlash
Vengeful Backlash.description:
Requirements You are standing on a solid surface

You circulate earth energy within yourself, ready to send shockwaves of backlash that punish those who dare to harm you with an equal but opposite reaction, even reverberating through their weapons. Until the beginning of your next turn (or until you are no longer standing on a solid surface, whichever comes first), all creatures that hit you with melee Strikes take bludgeoning damage from Vengeful Backlash equal to the result of their damage roll, before doubling the damage for a critical hit or adjusting for resistance, weakness, or the like.

While this effect lasts, you can choose to give yourself a circumstance penalty to AC against your foes' attacks, up to a maximum penalty of –4, in order to take more hits; you can select the penalty separately against each attack.

If no creatures hit you with melee Strikes while Vengeful Backlash is active, on your next turn, if you use a damaging earth power without a duration, that power deals additional @Damage[@actor.level[bludgeoning]] damage.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.EPPZVNLm4W9qwQAB]{Effect: Vengeful Backlash}

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1.

Vine Infestation.name: Vine Infestation
Vine Infestation.description:
You cause thorns and vines to infest a foe's body, continually piercing them and either sowing plants around them or harvesting to increase the damage and restrict their movement. Choose a foe within 60 feet. They take @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d4[persistent,piercing]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

Sow: You sow in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] around your target, now and each time they take the persistent piercing damage, as the vines grow out of them and onto the ground around them.

Harvest: You harvest either in the foe's space or in an adjacent square to increase the infestation's effects. The persistent damage increases by 1 for every two levels you have (rounded up), and while the persistent damage lasts the foe takes a circumstance penalty to their Speeds depending on the result of their saving throw; a –5-foot circumstance penalty on a success, a –10-foot circumstance penalty on a failure, and a –20 foot circumstance penalty on a critical failure.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.Ze09I0NqNmXbfe6A]{Effect: Vine Infestation}

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d4.

Vital Breath.name: Vital Breath
Vital Breath.description:
You breathe out a cone of vibrant life energy, providing living creatures in the area with renewed vigor. Choose to breathe life energy in a cone of your choice of size from 15 feet to 60 feet. Living creatures in the cone gain 1d4 temporary Hit Points plus 1d4 temporary Hit Points for every level you have) and gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls for 1 round. The temporary Hit Points last until you refresh. Undead creatures in the cone take @Damage[(4+(@actor.level*4))[vitality]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. On a failure, undead are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 round, and on a critical failure, they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.blkufFGRhvUBVIjL]{Effect: Vital Breath}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 4.

Vital Collapse.name: Vital Collapse
Vital Collapse.description:
You collapse an existing bundle of life force into an explosion that harms nearby foes. Choose yourself or an ally within 60 feet; your choice of target must have temporary Hit Points from one of your life powers. You remove all the target's temporary Hit Points, and the life energy explosively collapses.

This deals @Damage[(@actor.level@actor.system.attributes.hp.temp)[vitality]]{vitality damage} or @Damage[(@actor.level+@actor.system.attributes.hp.temp)[force]]{force damage} (whichever is better in each individual case) equal to your level plus the number of temporary Hit Points from your life powers to all of the target's foes within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Vital Collapse does not interact with the special reservoir of temporary Hit Points from Shared Vitality.

Vital Sacrifice.name: Vital Sacrifice
Vital Sacrifice.description:
Trigger A foe damages an ally, and the ally is within 30 feet of you.

You connect your life force to your ally, protecting them from harm, though not without cost for yourself. You heal your ally simultaneously as they receive the damage, for @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[healing]], an amount equal to 1 plus your level, or the total damage, whichever is lower. This effectively reduces the total damage by that amount. If there is any damage remaining, you lose an amount of Hit Points equal to 1 plus your level, or the remaining damage, whichever is lower, and you further reduce the damage to your ally by that amount. Any damage that still remains applies to your ally as normal.

Vital Singularity.name: Vital Singularity
Vital Singularity.description:
You combine yourself and several allies into a single amalgam of life force, distributing the shared vital energy however you see fit. Choose up to three non-minion allies of your level or higher within 40 feet of you (they don't all need to be within 40 feet of each other). You and the allies you chose momentarily merge into a singularity of life energy and then instantly separate.

When you separate, you and the allies can choose to switch positions with each other. You can distribute the Hit Points of yourself and the allies however you choose, except that no one can receive fewer than 1 Hit Point or more than their maximum Hit Points. This redistribution of Hit Points only affects actual Hit Points, not temporary Hit Points.

Afterward, you each gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level until the next time you refresh.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.DIPLUKPytQCW6kFc]{Effect: Vital Singularity}

Vital Touch.name: Vital Touch
Vital Touch.description:
Your touch infuses surging life force into a creature, healing the living and harming the undead. Touch a living creature within your reach or make a melee power attack roll against an undead creature within your reach to attempt to touch it. A living target gains 6 temporary Hit Points plus 6 temporary Hit Points per level you have, as well as a +2 status bonus to AC for 1 round. The temporary Hit Points last until you refresh.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.6q9GQbouYB04o2G7]{Effect: Vital Touch (Living)}

An undead target takes @Damage[(6+(6*@actor.level))[vitality]] damage, with effects depending on your @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll}; this has the attack trait.

Critical Success The undead takes double damage and a –2 status penalty to AC for 2 rounds.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.VURae9MMbPOLWlNJ]{Effect: Vital Touch (Undead, Critical Success)}

Success The undead takes full damage and a –2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

Failure Your touch barely grazes the undead. It takes only @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[vitality]] damage and a –1 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.pqxqIqe8RpRLvAel]{Effect: Vital Touch (Undead)}

Critical Failure Your touch misses the undead completely. It has no effect.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 6, or by 1 on a failure.

Water Barrier.name: Water Barrier
Water Barrier.description: You surround yourself in water, providing you many of the protections of being underwater. Until the beginning of your next turn, bludgeoning and slashing attacks take a –2 circumstance penalty against you and you gain resistance equal to your level to acid and fire damage. You Refresh your powers, which allows you to change to your choice of high tide or low tide.

Water Curtain.name: Water Curtain
Water Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of water across the battlefield, damaging foes and moving like a wave, pushing creatures along with it. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of water up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet long} in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(max((ceil(@actor.level/2)),6))d6[bludgeoning]] damage. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes bludgeoning damage and the reposition effect from Force Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times. While the curtain is greater difficult terrain for creatures without a swim Speed, it's thin enough that creatures can cross or exit the curtain as part of a Stride, without needing to Swim. Physical ranged attacks through the curtain take a –2 circumstance penalty, and creatures within or on the other side of the curtain gain resistance 5 to acid and fire attacks that need to enter or cross the curtain to reach them.

High Tide: At the end of your turn, you can choose to move the curtain up to 10 feet away from your initial position when you created it. If you do, creatures in the curtain, or who enter the curtain during its movement, move along with it.

Low Tide: At the end of your turn, you can choose to move the curtain up to 10 feet toward your initial position when you created it. If you do, creatures in the curtain, or who enter the curtain during its movement, move along with it.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Water Gaol.name: Water Gaol
Water Gaol.description:
You call forth a prison of water to immobilize and potentially drown your foe. Choose a foe within 60 feet. The target is affected depending on its @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

The gaol pops like a bubble if the target breaks free, and it otherwise lasts up to a maximum of 1 minute. While a foe is imprisoned in your water gaol, it's underwater and must hold its breath or begin suffocating unless it can breathe underwater. Additionally, the water gaol provides other @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.TPbr1kErAAJKBi3V]{effects} of being underwater: the foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} unless it has a swim Speed, it gains acid and fire resistance 5, bludgeoning and slashing melee attacks it makes or that are made against it take a –2 circumstance penalty, bludgeoning and slashing ranged attacks it makes or that are made against it automatically miss, and it can't use fire spells or actions.

High Tide: At the start of each of the imprisoned creature's turns, they take @Damage[@actor.level[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage from the high pressure. However, keeping up the pressure saps your strength. You're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} while the gaol lasts. At the end of each of the imprisoned creature's turns, you can move the water gaol up to 30 feet away from you. This movement ignores their immobilized condition.

Low Tide: At the end of each of the imprisoned creature's turns, you can move the water gaol up to 30 feet toward you. This movement ignores their immobilized condition. You gain greater cover against the imprisoned creature.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is barely trapped in the water gaol, so escaping is easy. The target is immobilized until it either Escapes against your power DC or succeeds at a @Check[type:athletics|dc:10] check to Swim out of the gaol.

Failure The target is imprisoned completely within the gaol. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it Escapes against your power DC.

Critical Failure The target is imprisoned and transfixed by the water pressure. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the water gaol until it Escapes against your power DC.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Weakening Field.name: Weakening Field
Weakening Field.description:
As you arrange death energy in a lattice around you, you recover your powers and create a weakening field to leach away your foes' strength. Foes within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] become enfeebled based on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save as long as they remain in the field. The field lasts until the end of your next turn. You Refresh your powers.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} as long as they remain in the field.

Failure The foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} as long as they remain in the field.

Critical Failure The foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} as long as they remain in the field.

Whirlwind.name: Whirlwind
Whirlwind.description:
You surge forward and then spin winds around you, slicing into your foes. Stride and then you deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[slashing]] damage to all foes in an emanation with your choice of size up to 20 feet, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]

@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]

@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]

@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Wind Barrier.name: Wind Barrier
Wind Barrier.description:
You create a dome of wind around you as you refresh your air powers, scattering ranged attacks while you recover. For 1 round, physical ranged attacks against you or an ally within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take a circumstance penalty depending on the size of the ranged weapon.

Attacks that use arrows, bolts, bullets, or similar ammunition take a –4 circumstance penalty, attacks with bigger ranged weapons, such as javelins, take a –2 circumstance penalty. Massive ranged weapons and spell effects that don't rely on physical objects pass through the winds with no penalty.

You Refresh your powers.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.uERezG076DkjIoUt]{Effect: Wind Barrier}

Wind Cutter.name: Wind Cutter
Wind Cutter.description:
You launch a blade of wind that grow larger and larger as it moves from its origin point, cutting through all creatures in the way. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[slashing]] to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] with an origin point anywhere within 60 feet (rather than from your square like most cone effects), with a @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Wind Rush.name: Wind Rush
Wind Rush.description:
You carry yourself through the air on a rush of wind and use the momentum to unleash a powerful slash on a foe. Stride up to two times and then make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll} against a foe within reach, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[slashing]] damage.

Critical Success You deal double slashing damage.

Success You deal normal slashing damage.

Failure Your slash misses, but the nearby air current grazes the target, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[slashing]] damage.

Critical Failure The slash misses completely, and the target is unharmed.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8, or 1 on a failure.

Wintry Vortex.description:
You surround yourself in a shapeable wintry vortex of swirling sleet and deepest cold. You deal an amount of cold damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4 +ceil(@actor.level/2))[cold]] damage to all foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], with results depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}.

Failure The creature takes full damage is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 3}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 4}.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.
Wintry Vortex.name: Wintry Vortex

Aeolus.name: 埃俄罗斯 Aeolus
Aeolus.description: 你从元素之风的源泉召唤出强大的气流，这些气流将你的盟友向前推进，并将你的敌人撕成碎片。气流在一条路径上吹动，路径宽度可达60英尺，长度可达1000英尺。你和区域内的盟友不会受到伤害，如果他们愿意，你可以将他们沿着路径的任何距离移动。区域内的敌人则会受到20d8的斩击伤害，需要进行一次基础反射豁免。@Template[type:line|distance:1000|width:60]{60 feet wide and up to 1,000 feet long}@Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[slashing]] @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true]

Ambush.name: 伏击 Ambush
Ambush.description:
你突然召唤出一丛意想不到的灌木，它从地面刺穿而出，提供掩护，并可能使他们失去平衡。在120英尺内一个15英尺×15英尺的正方形区域内的生物受到6d6穿刺伤害，需要进行一次基础反射豁免。 @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true]

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: 你在该区域内播种，创造出一丛灌木，只要它存在，就可以为你和你的盟友提供轻度掩护（但不会为你的敌人提供掩护）。如果你从这丛灌木中收割方格，区域内的敌人直到你下一个回合结束之前都会处于“措手不及”状态。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}
  • Harvest: 你在该区域内收割。除非敌人的豁免检定大成功，否则区域内的敌人直到你下一个回合结束之前都会处于“措手不及”状态。

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Amrita.name: 阿姆利塔 Amrita
Amrita.description:
你在濒死或最近死亡的生物身上滴下一滴超高浓度的液态生命能量，使它们能够体验到一丝不朽。选择一个30英尺内的活生物，或者一个在上一个回合内死亡的死生物。

该生物获得150生命值，如果它已死亡，则会复活，尽管阿姆利塔无法复活被消灭或死于死亡效果的生物。此外，尝试对影响该生物的每种毒素和疾病进行反制检定，使用你的威能DC-10作为抵消修正，以及你等级的一半（向上取整）作为反制等级。@Damage[150[healing]]

如果你以这种方式未能移除一种疾病，该疾病将在24小时内对阿姆利塔免疫。

Anansi.name: 阿南西 Anansi
Anansi.description:
模仿一位神话中的编织者和诡计者的技巧，你在各处交织着力场之线，对你的敌人造成毁灭性打击，并像操纵木偶一样在你周围移动所有人。这些力线在你周围形成一个200英尺的散发区域。你可以移动散发区域内的愿意的盟友，距离可达80英尺，且他们不会受到力线的伤害。@Template[type:emanation|distance:200]

另一方面，你对区域内的敌人造成20d6的力场伤害，具体结果取决于他们的基础强韧豁免。 @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[force]]@Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)]

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and you can reposition them up to 10 feet.

Failure The creature takes full damage and you can reposition them up to 20 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and you can reposition them up to 40 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Auto-Petrification.name: 自动石化 Auto-Petrification
Auto-Petrification.description: 你将自己转化为一座极为坚硬的石像，与大地调频并刷新你的土系能力。直到你的下一个回合开始，你处于石化（Petrified）状态，但你的硬度（Hardness）等于你的等级的四倍，而不是普通的8点硬度。然而，由于你在石化状态下防御等级（AC）较低，敌人很可能会对你造成暴击。你刷新了你的能力。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified}

Billowing Terror.name: 汹涌恐怖 Billowing Terror
Billowing Terror.description:
你用纯粹的恐怖将自己包围，这种恐怖汹涌而出，使你的敌人陷入惊慌。20英尺范围内的敌人将受到14d6心灵伤害，具体效果取决于他们的意志豁免。@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]@Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[mental]] @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)]

Critical Success 敌人不受影响。

Success 敌人受到一半伤害，并且处于恐惧1（Frightened 1）状态。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure敌人受到全额伤害，并且处于恐惧2（Frightened 2）状态。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure敌人受到双倍伤害，并且处于恐惧3（Frightened 3）状态。@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3}.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Blade of Light.name: 光之刃 Blade of Light
Blade of Light.description:
你召唤出一柄光之刃并刺向敌人，将他们笼罩在光芒中，并利用周围的光线为你提供优势。你对触及范围内的一个敌人造成3d8火焰伤害。具体结果取决于你的近战威能攻击投掷。如果目标处于轮廓鲜明（Limned）状态，他们将对这次攻击处于措手不及（Off-Guard）状态。@Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[fire]] @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll}. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard}

Critical Success 你造成双倍火焰伤害，并且目标直到你的下一个回合结束时都处于轮廓鲜明（Limned）和眩目（Dazzled）状态。@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}

Success 你造成正常的火焰伤害，并且目标直到你的下一个回合结束时都处于轮廓鲜明状态。

Failure 你的光之刃未命中，但目标必须选择让攻击擦过他们或因光芒飞过眼睛而变得眩目。目标直到你的下一个回合结束时都处于轮廓鲜明状态。此外，他们可以选择承受3点火焰伤害或直到你的下一个回合结束时处于眩目状态。@Damage[(2+@actor.level)[fire]]

Critical Failure 你的光之刃完全落空，目标未受到伤害。

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8, or 1 on a failure.

Brainstorm.name: Brainstorm
Brainstorm.description:
You call forth a storm of mental energy bubbling in an area, stealing your foes' ideas for yourself if you're in the area as well. The brainstorm fills a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 60 feet of you. Foes that enter or start their turn in the area take @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[mental]] damage and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn.

If you're in the area when a foe becomes stupefied, you steal their ideas and gain a +1 status bonus to Will saves, Perception checks, power attack rolls with mind powers, and skill checks based on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma until the end of your next turn.

A creature only takes mental damage and becomes stupefied from Brainstorm once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the area and then enters the area. The storm lasts until you refresh.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.7NCjs0bdgx7gRmq4]{Effect: Brainstorm}

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Bubble Burst.name: Bubble Burst
Bubble Burst.description:
You summon an enormous bubble around your foes, and it bursts, pushing foes outward or drawing them in. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[bludgeoning]] damage to all foes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 120 feet, depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage, but you take a –2 penalty to AC until the end of your next turn. Instead of pushing away from you, when the bubble burst moves a creature, they are moved away from the center of the burst. This is forced movement.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.4jBsevZHp1D3WFFu]{Effect: Bubble Burst (High Tide)}

Low Tide: Foes in the area take a –2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn unless they critically succeed at their saving throw. Instead of pulling toward you, when the bubble burst moves a creature, they are moved toward the center of the burst. This is forced movement. If there's not enough space near the center of the bubble, creatures nearer to the center move first, and others move as far as they can without being blocked, up to the amount set by their saving throw outcomes.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.eodo23kQ8nTVj5np]{Effect: Bubble Burst (Low Tide)}

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage and you move them 5 feet.

Failure The foe takes full damage and you move them 10 feet.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and you move them 20 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4, or 1d8 on high tide.

Brilliant Raiment.name: Brilliant Raiment
Brilliant Raiment.description:
You garb yourself in a raiment of brilliant light, damaging nearby creatures and dazzling them when they look upon you. Your shining raiment deals an amount of fire damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4+(ceil(@actor.level/2)))[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Until the end of your next turn, whenever a foe attempts to target you, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} during that attempt (the dazzled condition requires the foe to attempt the usual flat check, but the condition doesn't linger beyond that attempt).

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Death Pulse.name: Death Pulse
Death Pulse.description:
You pulse death energy around you, controlling the distance to limit the destruction to the surrounding environment. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[void]] damage, to all creatures in an emanation up to 30 feet, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. Small non-creature plants in the area, such as grass and ferns, wither and die.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Deathly Chill.name: Deathly Chill
Deathly Chill.description:
You infuse the ice and frost surrounding a foe with a harsh and deathly chill, causing it to sap away their warmth and life. Choose a foe with the frozen condition from your ice powers within 60 feet. At the end of each of its turns, the target takes a number of d10s of damage equal to its current frozen value (for instance, 5d10 at the end of its turn if it's currently frozen 5). This damage isn't persistent damage and can't be removed in the same way as persistent damage; instead, it lasts until the target is no longer frozen, at which point the effect ends.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.GxeutBq3kooYKzH1]{Frozen (Deathly Chill)}

Effulgent Explosion.name: Effulgent Explosion
Effulgent Explosion.description:
You charge up an explosion of effulgent light that limns creatures within for a lengthy period. The explosion forms in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within 360 feet, dealing @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[fire]] damage to each creature in the area, depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of your next turn and limned for 10 minutes.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is dazzled until the end of your next turn and limned for 1 hour.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Enfolding Roots.description:
You surround yourself with a field of roots, damaging foes and sowing or harvesting to provide you cover. You deal @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] damage, to all foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20], with results depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow within the area.
  • Harvest: You harvest in the area, transforming the harvested roots and plants into an enfolding barrier that provides standard @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Cover} to you and your allies (but not your foes) for 2 rounds.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.
Enfolding Roots.name: Enfolding Roots

Entangling Vines.name: Entangling Vines
Entangling Vines.description:
You sow a wide area of vines or harvest to ensnare your foes.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in a burst with a radius up to 30 feet, centered within 120 feet.
  • Harvest: You harvest in a burst with a radius up to 30 feet, centered within 120 feet. Foes in a harvested square must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save, with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds or until it Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first.

Failure The creature takes a –20-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds or until it Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and takes a –20-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. Both effects last for 2 rounds or until it Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.4rXXLUOJT0Uv56B5]{Effect: Entangling Vines}

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.1aKKXwItzYgOTRuH]{Effect: Entangling Vines (Failure)}

Enduring Verdure.name: Enduring Verdure
Enduring Verdure.description: You carefully rearrange the wood elemental energy around you in a way that won't disrupt any of the plants you've sown. You Refresh your powers, while maintaining all your sowed plants. They still fade away if you refresh in a different way later, such as the automatic refresh that happens at the end of an encounter.

Explode Corpse.name: Explode Corpse
Explode Corpse.description:
You send death energy into a creature's body, bloating it from the inside and causing it to explode upon death. Choose a creature within 60 feet. The target takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[void]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save. If this reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target explodes, dealing the same amount of damage to all creatures in an emanation of your choice of radius, up to 30 feet, with a basic Reflex save.

Creatures who die from the explosion continue to explode in the same way, though even if a creature is in the area of multiple such explosions, they only take damage once from Explode Corpse.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d8.

Entrench.name: Entrench
Entrench.description:
Requirements You are standing on a solid surface

You entrench yourself into the ground and immobilize yourself, making it difficult for foes to move you or move past you. You're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and gain a +4 status bonus to saving throws and DCs against effects that attempt to move you, and Entrench attempts a counteract check against those effects with a counteract modifier equal to your power DC – 10 and a counteract level equal to half your level rounded up.

Additionally, all squares within your reach are difficult terrain for your foes and when a foe enters your reach from a square outside your reach during their movement, they must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save against your power DC or their movement ends.

These effects last until you refresh, until you are no longer immobilized, until you move, or until you choose to end them as a free action, whichever comes first.

Exploding Bulwark.name: Exploding Bulwark
Exploding Bulwark.description:
You surround yourself in a bulwark of rock that prepares to explode, seeking out nearby foes, unless they chip it away first. When you use Exploding Bulwark, choose any number of foes within 20 feet, as an earthen bulwark grows over your body.

You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to AC from the rock bulwark until the beginning of your next turn, upon which the bulwark explodes, sending out countless stones that veer off to seek out and pummel any of the chosen foes that are within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60], dealing @Damage[(-3+@actor.level)d10[bludgeoning]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

However, each time a creature attempts a Strike against you before your next turn, unless the Strike is a critical failure, your circumstance bonus to AC from Exploding Bulwark decreases by 1 and the damage from the explosion decreases by 1d10, to a minimum of +0 AC and four fewer dice of damage.

Note: The displayed damage assumes no AC bonus remaining. Apply the below effect to calculate damage.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

Explosion.name: Explosion
Explosion.description:
You cause a burning creature to spontaneously combust, dealing explosive damage to themself and everything nearby. Choose a creature taking persistent fire damage within 60 feet. The target explodes, taking @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d10[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

You can choose how big of an explosion the target emits, with an emanation of at least 5 feet and up to 30 feet. All other creatures within the emanation take half the damage you rolled against the target (before applying the target's saving throw, resistances, weaknesses, and so on), with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

Exterminate.name: Exterminate
Exterminate.description:
You snuff out the life of weaklings all around you. All foes in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] around you either instantly die or take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[void]] damage, depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe's life can't be so easily snuffed out. The foe is unaffected by your Exterminate.

Success The foe withstands some of your extermination, though it still might die if it was particularly fragile. If the foe is a living creature and has fewer than [[(5* ceil(@actor.level/2))]] Hit Points (5 Hit Points for every two levels you have, rounded up), they instantly die. Otherwise, they take half damage.

Failure You exterminate the foe. If the foe is a living creature and has fewer than [[(5+(5*@actor.level))]] Hit Points (5 plus 5 Hit Points for each level you have), they instantly die. Otherwise, they take full damage.

Critical Failure You annihilate the foe. If the foe is a living creature and has fewer than [[(10+(10*@actor.level))]] Hit Points (10 plus 10 Hit Points for each level you have), they instantly die. Otherwise, they take double damage.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Fatal Weakness.name: Fatal Weakness
Fatal Weakness.description:
You leach away a creature's strength along with their life. Choose a creature within 60 feet. It takes @Damage[ceil(@actor.level/2)d6[void]] damage, and becomes enfeebled depending on the results of its @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature's life force is too strong to leach away, and the creature is unaffected.

Success You enfeeble the creature briefly. It takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 round.

Failure You greatly weaken the creature, with lingering effects. It takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} for 1 round, and enfeebled 1 for 1 minute.

Critical Failure You siphon an enormous portion of the creature's strength. It takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 4} for 1 round and enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Final Harvest.name: Final Harvest
Final Harvest.description:
You harvest plants you sowed around you in a wide area. You must harvest. When you do, you can harvest any plants you sowed within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] around you that you choose to harvest. This power can't harvest other plants. Foes in the area of the harvested plants take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[piercing]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Fire Arrow.name: Fire Arrow
Fire Arrow.description:
You shoot an arrow of pure fire to reduce your foe to cinders. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{ranged power attack roll} against a foe within 60 feet, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[fire],(1+(floor(@actor.level/2)))[persistent,fire]] damage. At 7th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, your fire arrow's range increases by 30 feet, to a maximum of 180 feet at 19th level.

Critical Success You deal double fire damage to the target.

Success You deal normal fire damage to the target.

Failure The arrow soars just past the target, but the embers still set them alight, dealing @Damage[(floor((1+(floor(@actor.level/2)))/2))[persistent,fire]] damage.

Critical Failure The arrow misses, dealing no damage.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Level (+2) The persistent damage increases by 1.

Fire Breath.name: Fire Breath
Fire Breath.description:
You breathe out an absolutely massive cone of fire like a red dragon, incinerating your foes. The cone is your choice of size from a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] to an @Template[type:cone|distance:80], and if you spend three actions, you can choose for the cone to be up to a @Template[type:cone|distance:120].

Creatures in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Fire Trap.name: Fire Trap
Fire Trap.description:
You place an incendiary trap on the ground, causing the first creature who steps on it to meet a fiery doom. Choose a 5-foot square on the ground within 60 feet. The first creature that enters the chosen square, as well as all other creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] from the square, takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d12[fire]] damage, with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

While those watching you use Fire Trap can clearly see where you placed it, after using Fire Trap, it becomes difficult to notice, requiring a @Check[type:perception|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] check against your power DC to do so. The trap lasts until you refresh.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1d12.

Flamewrack.name: Flamewrack
Flamewrack.description:
You wrack your burning foes with flames, searing their bodies with a sickening char. You deal @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[fire]] damage to each foe within 40 feet that is taking persistent fire damage, with effects depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and takes a –1 status penalty to saving throws and AC until they spend a single action to remove the penalty.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 4}.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.bk715G04Rz88DQbF]{Effect: Flamewrack (Success)}

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Flash Flood.name: Flash Flood
Flash Flood.description:
You create a sudden flood that waterlogs the area. The flood rushes through a 50-foot by 50-foot area within 200 feet. Foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[bludgeoning]] damage, based on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] saves. The area becomes difficult terrain except for creatures with a swim Speed until you refresh.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage, but you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of your next turn.

Low Tide: The area retains water up to knee height and becomes greater difficult terrain to creatures without a swim Speed, instead of difficult terrain.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes half damage and you move them 10 feet.

Failure The foe takes full damage and you move them 20 feet.

Critical Failure The foe takes double damage and you move them 40 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or 1d8 on high tide.

Floral Embrace.name: Floral Embrace
Floral Embrace.description:
You cover yourself in blooming flowers and burrs, which damage those who come in contact with you. Until you refresh, adjacent creatures that hit you with a melee attack, as well as creatures that touch you or hit you with an unarmed attack, take @Damage[ (@actor.level)[piercing]] damage, and you sow in your square (or one of your squares if you are Large or Larger) or an adjacent square.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Flowing River.name: Flowing River
Flowing River.description:
You flow forward in a rush of water, leaving behind a winding river to batter your foes. You either Stride or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.21WIfSu7Xd7uKqV8]{Tumble Through}, leaving behind frothing waters in any space you enter during the movement, which last until the end of your next turn. Foes who start their turn in the waters or pass through the waters take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[bludgeoning]] damage and might be moved along the river depending on their @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

A creature only takes bludgeoning damage from Flowing River and risks being moved once, even if it starts its turn in the waters and then crosses the waters, or crosses the waters several times.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage. After completing your movement for Flowing River, you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the end of your next turn. When you move a creature away from you, they follow the path of the river instead of moving directly away.

Low Tide: After completing your movement for Flowing River, you gain a +30-foot status bonus to your Speeds until the end of your next turn. When you move a creature toward you, they follow the path of the river instead of moving directly toward you.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.mXZVdxasiR7QA8uU]{Effect: Flowing River (Low Tide)}

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage and you move them 10 feet.

Failure The target takes full damage and you move them 20 feet.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage and you move them 30 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4, or 1d8 on high tide.

Flurry.name: Flurry
Flurry.description:
You fling a flurry of snow, sleet, and cold, chilling creatures. You deal an amount of cold damage equal to @Damage[((1+@actor.level)d4+(ceil(@actor.level/2)))[cold]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:30], with effects depending on their @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

At 5th level, you can choose to increase the size of the line to a @Template[type:line|distance:40] when you use Flurry, and every 4 levels thereafter you can increase the size of the line by 10 additional feet, to a maximum of 70 feet at 17th level.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 1}.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 2}.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.OyojvmEKkLrUxX1W]{Frozen 4}.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1.

Foe Throw.description:
You throw one foe at another. Choose a foe within 120 feet and attempt to throw them into another foe within 30 feet of that foe, depending on the result of the first foe's @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save. If there isn't a second foe within range, you instead throw the foe at a square of your choice within 30 feet, ignoring any listed effect to the second foe.

Critical Success You can't throw the foe, and it's entirely unaffected.

Success The foe manages to resist being thrown for the most part, but not without a cost. It chooses whether to take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[force]] damage and stay in place, or to fly toward the second foe but land safely and undamaged in a space of its choice adjacent to the second foe.

Failure You throw the first foe into the second. The first foe takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[force],(1+@actor.level)d4[bludgeoning]] damage and lands in the closest unoccupied space to their starting location that's adjacent to the target. Attempt a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack roll} against the second foe; this has the attack trait. On a success, the second foe takes the same damage as the first foe and on a critical success, both foes take @Damage[((1+@actor.level)*4)[force],((1+@actor.level)*4)[bludgeoning]]{maximum damage}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the first foe takes double damage (this could potentially lead to dealing double maximum damage on a critical hit).

Level (+1) The force and bludgeoning damage increase by 1d4.
Foe Throw.name: Foe Throw

Galeforce Launch.name: Galeforce Launch
Galeforce Launch.description:
You launch yourself into the wind and then plummet to the ground in the midst of a slashing explosion. You Fly up to 30 feet into the air, whether or not you normally have a fly Speed, then soar down to any space within 200 feet. Creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d8[slashing]], with a @Check[type:Reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Grasping Permafrost.name: Grasping Permafrost
Grasping Permafrost.description: You cause the frost surrounding your foes to grasp and extend further into their bodies, causing them intense harm. Foes within 120 feet who have the frozen condition from your ice powers take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[cold]] damage, plus an additional number of d8s of cold damage equal to their frozen value, with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

Grasping Vines.name: Grasping Vines
Grasping Vines.description:
Trigger A foe within 60 feet moves through an area you can harvest.

You harvest from the plants surrounding your foe to transform them into grasping vines meant to ruin their movement. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The space the creature is moving through is greater difficult terrain until the end of its turn and the creature takes a –5- foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until the end of its turn or until it Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first.

Failure As success, except you disrupt the triggering movement.

Critical Failure As success, except you disrupt the triggering movement and the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until the end of its turn or until it Escapes against your power DC, whichever comes first.

Gusting Curtain.name: Gusting Curtain
Gusting Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of wind across the battlefield, slashing those who cross it and pushing back ranged attacks against your allies. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of wind up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet long in a straight line}, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[ceil(@actor.level/2)d6[slashing]] damage. Additionally, you can choose to have the curtain provide a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against your enemies' physical ranged attacks other than unusually massive ranged projectiles (such as boulders or ballista bolts) as you blow them away. The winds accelerate your allies physical ranged attacks that pass through the curtain, granting them a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll instead. The curtain lasts until you refresh. A creature only takes slashing damage from Gusting Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage increases by 1d6.

Harden.name: Harden
Harden.description:
Trigger A creature deals physical damage to you

You harden yourself with earth to resist the attack against you. You gain resistance equal to 5 plus your level to physical damage (except adamantine) against the triggering attack.

Harvest Shield.name: Harvest Shield
Harvest Shield.description:
Trigger A creature targets you with an attack, you can see the attacker, and there is a plant you can harvest in your space or an adjacent space.

You harvest a plant to create a wooden shield that protects you from harm. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against the attack roll and until the beginning of your next turn. You additionally gain resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage equal to your level against the triggering attack, as the plants remain alive and protect your body from harm.

Hindering Winds.name: Hindering Winds
Hindering Winds.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to move toward you during a move action

You send a wind to hinder the triggering creature's progress toward you. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save, with the following effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and can move normally during this action.

Success The wind makes it harder for the creature to move toward you. Any movement toward you is difficult terrain during this action (or greater difficult terrain if it is already over difficult terrain).

Failure The wind prevents the creature from moving toward you. It can't move toward you during this action.

Critical Failure The wind blows the creature to the ground, disrupting its move action and knocking it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Illuminating Curtain.name: Illuminating Curtain
Illuminating Curtain.description:
You trace a curtain of light across the battlefield, limning and dazzling those who cross it. You create a 5-foot thick curtain of light up to 10 feet high and up to @Template[type:line|distance:60]{60 feet long} in a straight line, calling forth the curtain within 120 feet. The curtain is so bright that the light conceals everything on the other side, though you and your allies ignore the concealment from the curtain, as the light reveals its secrets to you. Any creature that crosses the curtain or is occupying the curtain's area at the start of its turn takes @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[fire]] damage and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.conditions.5tWqbv3Iu1FlrOx6]{Limned} until the end of their next turn. The curtain lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes fire damage from Illuminating Curtain once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the curtain and then crosses the curtain, or crosses the curtain several times.

Level (+2) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Interrupting Torrent.name: Interrupting Torrent
Interrupting Torrent.description:
Trigger A foe within 60 feet takes a move action

As your foe begins to move, you quickly push or pull them depending on your tide, throwing off their positioning. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save with the following effects.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success You move the foe 15 feet, just before they move.

Failure You move the foe 30 feet, just before they move.

Critical Failure You move the foe 30 feet and the torrent disrupts the triggering move action.

Labyrinth of Twisted Thoughts.name: Labyrinth of Twisted Thoughts
Labyrinth of Twisted Thoughts.description:
You send your foes' minds into a tangled skein of bewildering and unfathomable thoughts, confusing them and damaging their minds. Foes within an @Template[type:cone|distance:80] take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d4[mental]] damage and potentially becoming confused, with results depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

Critical Success The foe is unaffected.

Success The foe takes full mental damage but their mind escapes the tangled labyrinth easily, and they aren't confused.

Failure The foe takes full mental damage, and they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round as their thoughts become trapped in the labyrinth.

Critical Failure The foe takes double mental damage, and they are confused for 1 minute as their thoughts become trapped in the labyrinth. At the end of each of their turns, they can attempt a new Will save against your power DC to remove the confused condition early.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d4.

Leviathan.name: Leviathan
Leviathan.description:
You call upon a mythical whale serpent of water through your will, and it coils around all your foes, trapping them for a brief moment within its churning metaphysical gullet unless they resist its call. The leviathan affects everything within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:200] around you. All foes in the area take @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d6[bludgeoning]] damage, with results depending on their @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)] save.

High Tide: The damage is @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d10[bludgeoning]|options:high-tide-power] damage, but you take a –2 penalty to your Will saves until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.ozmTj0Bri31NqMEo]{Effect: Leviathan (High Tide)}

Low Tide: As you pull the leviathan's power into yourself, it blesses you with heroic might. You gain a +2 status bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.4oX7oo58xL8eDDvk]{Effect: Leviathan (Low Tide)}

Critical Success The creature takes no damage and you move them 5 feet.

Success The creature takes half damage and you move them 10 feet.

Failure The creature takes full damage and you move them 20 feet.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and you move them 40 feet.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d6, or 1d10 on high tide.

Life Buffer.name: Life Buffer
Life Buffer.description:
You send a powerful surge of vital essence into a creature within 30 feet, creating a life buffer that protects a living creature or damages an undead creature. If the target is a living creature, they gain 1d10 temporary Hit Points plus an additional 1d10 temporary Hit Points for each level you have. These temporary Hit Points last until you refresh.

If they're an undead creature, they instead take the same amount of @Damage[(1+@actor.level)d10[vitality]] damage with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.p1FSamqUxqbkr1SV]{Effect: Life Buffer}

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d10.

Life Cocoon.name: Life Cocoon
Life Cocoon.description:
As you recalibrate the strands of vital essence all around you, you draw them all in toward yourself, weaving a cocoon of life energy and surrounding yourself. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by the cocoon, but you gain temporary Hit Points equal to 3 plus three times your level, both lasting until the end of your next turn. You Refresh your powers.

If you lose all the temporary Hit Points, you are no longer immobilized, and if the immobilized condition ends or you move or are moved, the temporary Hit Points end. You can choose to end both the immobilized condition and temporary Hit Points as a free action, which has the concentrate trait.

Life Vortex.name: Life Vortex
Life Vortex.description:
You trace a vortex of life energy as you draw all the harms out from the allies around you. You Refresh your powers. You then remove all your temporary Hit Points. For each of your allies within 30 feet, you can choose to lose Hit Points equal to 10 plus your level (@Damage[(10+@actor.level)[untyped]]) or the amount of Hit Points they are missing, whichever is less. If you do, you heal your ally, restoring their Hit Points for an equal amount.

After applying all the lost Hit Points and healing, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to half the Hit Points you lost in this way until the end of your next turn.

Lifebond.name: Lifebond
Lifebond.description:
You temporarily connect the life force of one willing target to those of several other willing creatures in order to protect the target from harm. Choose one willing target within 30 feet, later referred to as the primary target, and up to three other willing creatures within 30 feet, later referred to as protectors. You can be the primary target or a protector. The protectors must be of the primary target's level or higher, and they can't be minions, though the primary target can be a minion.

The primary target gains temporary Hit Points equal to your level until you refresh. Until you refresh, the protectors lose Hit Points equal to the damage dealt to the primary target (after applying weaknesses, resistances, and the like) divided by the number of protectors + 1, while the primary target reduces the damage by the total number of Hit Points the protectors lost. For example, if you include three protectors and the primary target takes a total of 26 damage after resistances, weaknesses, and the like, each protector loses 6 Hit Points, and the primary target only takes 8 damage.

If a protector becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}, they automatically cease being a protector, though the Lifebond continues for the duration as long as at least one protector remains.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.rDJio8T2c3kV0KBV]{Effect: Lifebond (Primary)}

Mind Palace.name: Mind Palace
Mind Palace.description:
You erect a palatial mental defense around yourself and your allies, granting your beleaguered minds refuge from what assails them as you bring your mental energies back in order. For 1 round, you and all allies within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] gain a +2 status bonus all Will saves.

You and each ally in the area when you use Mind Palace immediately reduce your frightened condition by 1 and then you can attempt another Will save throw against a mental effect with a duration affecting you that allows a Will save, removing the effect on a successful save. The mental effect then becomes temporarily immune to your Mind Palace for 1 day. You Refresh your powers.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.zHioW4ts7mElDgz6]{Effect: Mind Palace}

Mirror's Reflections.name: Mirror's Reflections
Mirror's Reflections.description:
You spin three images out of light that appear to be you. Three images of you formed out of light swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on 1d4). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1–2 on 1d6). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1–3 on 1d6).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn’t critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, or when you Refresh, the power’s effect ends.

Mortal Reprieve.name: Mortal Reprieve
Mortal Reprieve.description:
Trigger A foe deals damage to you.

You call upon the power of life to suspend any incoming harm, giving you time to deal with it before it lays you low. You don't take the damage until the beginning of the triggering foe's next turn. You normally take any other effects that came at the same time as the damage. For instance, a cold power that deals cold damage and gives you the frozen condition would still make you frozen, or a water power that damages and pushes you would still push you. However, if the secondary effect is contingent on damage being dealt, such as an injury poison delivered by a snake's fangs or a poisoned weapon, or a disease from a rat or ghoul's jaws, you don't take the secondary effect yet either.

During the intervening time, you can choose to use any healing or temporary Hit Points you receive from your own life powers to instead reduce an equal amount of the pending damage. If you reduce the pending damage to 0, you never take the damage, which also prevents you from taking damage-dependent secondary effects.

Special If you're an eldamon who is currently phased in and you use Mortal Reprieve but then phase out before taking the damage on the triggering foe's next turn, your eldamon trainer takes the damage, as well as the other associated effects when the time comes to take the consequences.

Muninn.name: Muninn
Muninn.description:
You call upon a legendary messenger of thought, calling forth a flock of thoughtform ravens to harry your foes and guide your allies' thoughts. The ravens appear within 200 feet, occupy a 15-foot by 15-foot area, similar to the size of a Huge creature, and lasts until you refresh. Just after using this power, and then again at the beginning of each of your turns, you can use a free action, which has the concentrate trait, to move the ravens up to 60 feet in any direction, including vertically, though the ravens collapse back into insubstantial figments of the imagination if they ever move more than 500 feet from your position.

All foes that come within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] of the ravens take @Damage[(floor(@actor.level/2))d10[mental]] damage with a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.system.proficiencies.classDCs.eldamon.dc)|basic:true] save; they take damage only once per round, regardless of how many times they come near the ravens. Allies within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] of the ravens gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls, Perception checks, saving throws, and skill checks while they are in the area as the ravens assist them.

@UUID[Compendium.battlezoo-eldamon-pf2e.effects.Item.xYiSBjEMrjwSU6hL]{Effect: Muninn}

Level (20th) The damage increases by 1d10.

Needle Storm.name: Needle Storm
Needle Storm.description:
You conjure a storm of needles that skewer your foes and either sow cacti or harvest to empower the storm. The needle storm fills a @Template[type:burst|distance:20] within 120 feet of you. Creatures that enter or start their turn in the area take @Damage[(ceil(@actor.level/2))d6[piercing]] damage. The storm lasts until you refresh.

A creature only takes piercing damage from Needle Storm once during each of its turns, even if it starts its turn in the area and then enters the area.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow cacti in the area. When you harvest the cacti, any creatures either in a cactus's space or adjacent to a cactus takes @Damage[(1+@actor.level)[piercing]] damage. A creature only takes this damage once per harvest, regardless of the number of cacti. 
  • Harvest: You harvest in the area, increasing the number of needles in any harvested square. The needle storm deals additional @Damage[(@actor.level)[piercing]] damage equal to your level each round in all harvested squares.

Level (+1) The damage is increased by 1 for Sow and Harvest.

Level (+2) The damage is increased by 1d6.

Piercing Branch.name: Piercing Branch
Piercing Branch.description:
You extend a branch from your body or a nearby plant like a stake to impale your foe. Make a @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{melee power attack roll} against a foe within your reach, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d8[piercing]] damage.

Choose to either sow or harvest.

  • Sow: You sow in your target's square or a square adjacent to the target.
  • Harvest: You harvest a space within 30 feet into the branch you use to attack. You make the melee attack against a foe in the harvested space or adjacent to the harvested space, instead of a target within your reach.

Critical Success You deal double piercing damage.

Success You deal normal piercing damage.

Failure You only graze the target, dealing @Damage[(2+@actor.level)[piercing]] damage.

Critical Failure Your branch misses completely, and the target is unharmed.

Level (+1) The damage increases by 1d8, or 1 on a failure.

Piercing Spike.name: Piercing Spike
Piercing Spike.description:
You create a spike of stone and twist it as you shoot it forth, piercing through several foes in a line. Make @Check[type:eldamon-power-attack|defense:ac]{power attack rolls} against each foe in a @Template[type:line|distance:15]. They take @Damage[(2+@actor.level)d6[piercing]] damage, depending on the results of your power attack roll.

If your reach is greater than 5 feet, the length of the line is equal to your reach + 10 (a @Template[type:line|distance:20] for 10-foot reach, a @Template[type:line|distance:25] for 15-foot reach, and so on).

Critical Success You deal double damage to the foe, and they take a –2 status penalty on attack rolls for 1 round from the spike's fragments unless they or an ally spend an Interact action to remove them first.
